page.title: 17Ecology(3)
page.content: Of the several footpaths crossing our area some have been planted over by local farmers and disappeared but some are still used regularly. The footpath from Hask Barn to the Rectory no longer exists,it is now a wheat field.From Pontshill Marsh to Groomstool barn(now demolished)there is a partly used footpath,but the hedge half way along has been taken up where it cuts across to the Lea road. There is a good footpath from Eccleswall Farm to Ryeford.It starts off as a good farm track and because of the number of different types of trees on it,may be 300 years old.After 1 field the track ends in a field of wheat.The path then runs along the hedgerow to Ryeford.This would make a good short cut from Bromsash to Ryeford.From Lea road to Burton Court is a well used farm track.
